qas.question: Why is depicting God forbidden in the Islamic world?

answers.text: such artistic depictions may lead to idolatry

qas.question: What do Muslims believe of the form of God?
How many sura's in the Quran begin with "In the name of God?"
What is the policy in the Muslim world on depicting Mohammed?
What other religions might one find depictions of God, or Prophets forbidden?
Why are depictions of God discouraged in Islam?

plausible_answers.text: "In the name of God, the Beneficent, the Merciful".

qas.question: What does one of the Sura in the Quran begin with?
What other religions do not have restrictions on depicting God?
What prophet is often depicted in the Muslim World?

context: No Islamic visual images or depictions of God are meant to exist because it is believed that <a0_0>such artistic depictions <b5_0>may lead to idolatry<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Moreover, Muslims believe that <a1_0>God is incorporeal<a1_0/>, making any two- or three- dimensional depictions impossible. Instead, Muslims describe God by the names and attributes that, according to Islam, he revealed to his creation. <a2_0>All but one<a2_0/> sura of the Quran begins with the phrase <b6_0>"In the name of God, the Beneficent, the Merciful".<b6_0/> Images of <b8_0>Mohammed<b8_0/> are likewise <a3_0>prohibited<a3_0/>. Such aniconism and iconoclasm can also be found in <a4_0><b7_0>Jewish and some Christian theology<b7_0/><a4_0/>.
